required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of a Protective Message on Critical Evaluation of Fake News
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Source Type and Protective Message on the Critical Evaluation of News Messages on Facebook: An Experimental Study in the Netherlands.

brief_summary.textblock:
Background: Disinformation has become an increasing societal concern, especially due to the speed that news is shared in the current digital era. In particular in the healthcare sector disinformation can lead to serious casualties, as the current COVID-19 crisis clearly shows.
Objective: The main aim of this study was to experimentally examine the effects of information about the source's and a displayed protective warning message on users' critical evaluation of news items, as well as the perception of accuracy of the news item.
Methods: A 3(unreliable versus reliable versus no identified source) x 2 (protective message: with versus without) between subject design has been conducted among 307 participants (mean age = 29 years, SD = 10.9 years).

primary_outcome.measure: Critical evaluation of source and news

arm_group.description: In this condition participants receive a news message from an unreliable source
In this condition participants receive a news message from an reliable source
In this condition participants receive a news message without a source

intervention.description: The main intervention was the source of the news that was shown to participants

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Facebook user
- older than 18
- Dutch
Exclusion Criteria:
- younger than 18 years
- no facebook

facility.name: Tilburg School of Humanities and Digital Sciences

patient_data.ipd_description: Upon reasonable request we will decide to share the data with other researchers
